sen.j: まいづるとは、西日本旅客鉄道が京都駅～東舞鶴駅間を山陰本線・舞鶴線経由で運行する特別急行列車。
sen.e: "Maizuru" is a Limited Express train operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West) between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station, via San'in Main Line and Maizuru Line.
"Maizuru" is a limited express train operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station via the San'in Main Line and Maizuru Line.
"Maizuru" is a limited express train operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station via the Sanin Main Line and Maizuru Line.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを削除し、Sanin としました。

sen.j: イメージカラーは橙色。
sen.e: Its symbol color is orange.
Its symbol color is orange.
Its symbol color is orange.

sen.j: 舞鶴の舞鶴赤レンガ倉庫群にちなんでいる。
sen.e: The color derives from a complex of red brick warehouses in Maizuru City
sen.cmt: 舞鶴赤レンガ倉庫群→a complex of red brick warehouses [http://www.jnto.go.jp/tourism/en/s056.html]
sen.e: The color is derived from a complex of red-brick warehouses in Maizuru City.
The color is derived from a complex of red-brick warehouses in Maizuru City.

sen.j: 本列車群は1999年（平成11年）10月に舞鶴線電化開業にあわせて新設されたものであるが、前身は1972年（昭和47年）10月ダイヤ改正の急行「きのさき_(列車)」の増発により新設された（山陰本線京都方面からの）東舞鶴駅直通列車である。
sen.e: This fleet was introduced, following the electrification and renewed operation of the Maizuru Line, and its predecessor was a direct train bound for Higashi Maizuru Station (proceeded from the Kyoto area on the San'in Main Line), which was set up when Express "Kinosaki (train)" increased the frequency of service with the timetable revision made in October 1999.

This fleet was introduced following the electrification and renewed operation of the Maizuru Line, and its predecessor was a direct train bound for Higashi Maizuru Station that proceeded from the Kyoto area on the San'in Main Line, which was set up when the express "Kinosaki" train increased the frequency of service with the timetable revision of October 1999.

This fleet was introduced following the electrification and renewed operation of the Maizuru Line in October, 1999, and its predecessor was a direct train bound for Higashi-Maizuru Station that proceeded from the Kyoto area on the Sanin Main Line, which was set up when the Express 'Kinosaki (train)' increased the frequency of service with the timetable revision of October 1972.
sen.cmt: 1999年（平成11年）10月 を追加しました。アポストロフィを削除し、Sanin としました。急行「きのさき_(列車)」→Express 'Kinosaki (train)' としました。

sen.j: その後、1985年（昭和60年）には特急「きのさき_(列車)」が東舞鶴までの運転を開始した。
sen.e: After that, in 1985 Limited Express "Kinosaki (train)" began operating up to Higashi Maizuru Station
Subsequently, in 1985 the limited express "Kinosaki" train began operating up to Higashi Maizuru Station.
Subsequently, in 1985 the Limited Express 'Kinosaki (train)' began operating up to Higashi-Maizuru Station.
sen.cmt: 特急「きのさき_(列車)」→Limited Express 'Kinosaki (train)' としました。

sen.j: しかし1996年(平成8年)3月に山陰本線の園部駅～綾部駅間が電化され、京都駅～城崎温泉駅間が全線電化されると特急「あさしお」と急行「丹後」は廃止され、東舞鶴直通列車は一時的に全廃された。
sen.e: However, in March 1996, when the section between Sonobe Station and Ayabe Station on the San'in Main Line was electrified, and the whole line between Kyoto Station and Kinosakionsen Station was also electrified, the operation of Limited Express "Asashio" and Express "Tango" was discontinued and the direct trains bound for Higashi-Maizuru Station were totally suspended.

However, in March 1996, when the section between Sonobe Station and Ayabe Station on the San'in Main Line was electrified and the entire line between Kyoto Station and Kinosakionsen Station was also electrified, the operation of the limited express "Asashio" and express "Tango" was discontinued and the direct trains bound for Higashi-Maizuru Station were totally suspended.

However, in March 1996, when the section between Sonobe Station and Ayabe Station on the Sanin Main Line was electrified and the entire line between Kyoto Station and Kinosakionsen Station was also electrified, the operation of the Limited Express 'Asashio' and Express 'Tango' was discontinued and the direct trains bound for Higashi-Maizuru Station were totally suspended.
sen.cmt: 特急「あさしお」→Limited Express 'Asashio' 急行「丹後→Express 'Tango' としました。

sen.j: そのため、国際コンテナ航路を有し、近畿地方の日本海側のおける玄関港となっている舞鶴港を擁し、また北近畿の中心都市である舞鶴市への直通列車の廃止は利便性を著しく悪化させる結果となった。
sen.e: Consequently, the discontinued service of the direct train to Maizuru City seriously hampered the convenience of the area, because the city is not only the center of the northern Kinki region but also it has Maizuru Port which is a water gateway on the Sea of Japan side, having an international container shipping route.

Consequently, the discontinued service of the direct train to Maizuru City seriously hampered the convenience of the area, because the city wasn't just the center of the northern Kinki region but also had Maizuru Port, a water gateway on the Sea of Japan side having an international container shipping route.

Consequently, the discontinued service of the direct train to Maizuru City seriously hampered the convenience of the area, because the city wasn't just the center of the northern Kinki region but also had Maizuru Port, a water gateway on the Sea of Japan side having an international container shipping route.

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）10月に悲願であった舞鶴線電化工事が完了し、本列車群が1日3往復設定され誕生した。
sen.e: In October 1999, The earnestly desired electrification of the Maizuru Line was completed and the fleet of this type of train was introduced with 3 round-trip service a day.
In October 1999, the earnestly desired electrification of the Maizuru Line was completed and the fleet of this type of train was introduced with three round-trip services daily.
In October 1999, the earnestly desired electrification of the Maizuru Line was completed and the fleet of this type of train was introduced with three round-trip services daily.

sen.j: その後、利便性向上が図られ、2.5往復増発され、現在では5.5往復が運転されている。
sen.e: Later, further convenience was achieved by adding another 2.5 round-trip operation, and nowadays, the train provides 5.5 round-trip service a day.
Later, that convenience was enhanced with the addition of 2.5 round-trip operations, and nowadays the train provides 5.5 round-trip services a day.
Later, that convenience was enhanced with the addition of 2.5 round-trip operations, and nowadays the train provides 5.5 round-trip services a day.

sen.j: また2003年（平成15年）には小浜線が電化開業を果たし、観光シーズンや祝休日などの多客期には小浜線の小浜駅まで乗り入れるようになった。
sen.e: In addition, since the Obama Line was electrified and opened in 2003, when there are many passengers such as during the tourist seasons and on holidays, the train is operated up to Obama Station running on the Obama Line.

Additionally, since the Obama Line was electrified and opened in 2003, when there are many passengers such as during the tourist seasons and on holidays, the train is operated up to Obama Station running on the Obama Line.

Additionally, since the Obama Line was electrified and opened in 2003, when there are many passengers such as during the tourist seasons and on holidays, the train is operated up to Obama Station running on the Obama Line.

sen.j: それに合わせて、若狭本郷・若狭高浜～京都市内間を、同列車などの普通車自由席を使って移動できる「京都往復割引きっぷ」が新設された（6,000円）。
sen.e: At the same time, "Kyoto Discount Round Trip Ticket," which permits unlimited use to trip between Wakasa-Hongo/Wakasa-Takahama and Kyoto City by using a non-reserved seat of ordinary cars of Limited Express trains including this service (6,000yen)

Concurrently, "Kyoto Discount Round Trip Ticket," which permits unlimited use for travel between Wakasa-Hongo/Wakasa-Takahama and Kyoto City by using the non-reserved seats of ordinary cars of limited express trains, including this service (6,000 yen).

Concurrently, 'Kyoto Discount Round Trip Ticket,' which permits unlimited use for travel between Wakasa-Hongo/Wakasa-Takahama and Kyoto City by using the non-reserved seats of ordinary cars of limited express trains, including this service (6,000 yen).

sen.j: 他交通機関との競合
sen.e: Competition with other means of transportation
Competition with other means of transportation
Competition with other means of transportation

sen.j: 舞鶴市は海事機関を中心とする官公庁が集積する行政都市という側面から、ビジネス利用が多い土地柄である。
sen.e: Since Maizuru City has an aspect of an administrative center with a various public and government offices mostly related to maritime affairs, the train is frequently used for business trips.

Because Maizuru City has the aspect of an administrative center with various public and government offices, most of which are related to maritime affairs, the train is frequently used for business travel.

Because Maizuru City has the aspect of an administrative center with various public and government offices, most of which are related to maritime affairs, the train is frequently used for business travel.

sen.j: そのため「まいづる」も激しい競争にさらされている。
sen.e: In this sense, "Maizuru" is also facing with an severe competition.
In that sense, "Maizuru" also faces severe competition.
In that sense, 'Maizuru' also faces severe competition.

sen.j: 概ね対京都方面輸送においては、京都縦貫自動車道が現在全通していないことや、京都交通 (舞鶴)の舞鶴－京都便が1日4往復と少ないため優位な立場である。
sen.e: Generally speaking, concerning the transportation to the Kyoto area, the train maintains an advantage because Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado () has not been thoroughly open to traffic yet, and the bus service that Kyoto Kotsu (in Maizuru) provides between Maizuru and Kyoto is limited to 4 round-trip a day.
sen.cmt: 京都縦貫自動車道→Kyoto Jukan Expressway (Trans Kyoto Expressway) [http://www.motorways-exitlists.com/asia/j/japan.htm]、京都交通→Kyoto Kotsu [http://www.kyotokotsu.jp/index.html]
sen.e: Generally, concerning the transportation to the Kyoto area, the train maintains an advantage because Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado () hasn't yet been fully opened to traffic, and the bus service that Kyoto Kotsu (in Maizuru) provides between Maizuru and Kyoto is limited to four round trips a day.

Generally, concerning the transportation to the Kyoto area, the train maintains an advantage because Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway hasn't yet been fully opened to traffic, and the bus service that Kyoto Kotsu (Maizuru) provides between Maizuru and Kyoto is limited to four round trips a day.
sen.cmt: 京都縦貫自動車道→Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway としました。

sen.j: しかしながら、2014年には京都縦貫道が全通することから、予断を許していない。
sen.e: However, the situation does not allow optimism because in 2014 the whole section of the Kyoto Jukan Expressway (Trans Kyoto Expressway) is scheduled to be opened up,.
sen.cmt: 京都縦貫自動車道→Kyoto Jukan Expressway (Trans Kyoto Expressway) [http://www.motorways-exitlists.com/asia/j/japan.htm]
sen.e: However, the situation doesn't allow optimism because, in 2014, the whole section of the Kyoto Jukan Expressway (Trans Kyoto Expressway) is scheduled to be opened up.
However, the situation doesn't allow optimism because, in 2014, the whole section of the Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway is scheduled to be opened up.
sen.cmt: 京都縦貫自動車道→Kyoto Longitudinal Expressway としました。

sen.j: 対大阪・神戸方面輸送においては、舞鶴若狭自動車道が舞鶴－神戸間が全通していることから、京都交通バスが極めて優勢である。
sen.e: For the transportation to Osaka and Kobe, Kyoto Kotsu Bus enjoys a more competitive position because Maizuru Wakasa Express Way has already opened up the whole section between Maizuru and Kobe.
For transportation to Osaka and Kobe, Kyoto Kotsu Bus enjoys a more competitive position because the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway has already opened up the entire section between Maizuru and Kobe.
For transportation to Osaka and Kobe, Kyoto Kotsu Bus enjoys a more competitive position because the Maizuru Wakasa Expressway has already opened up the entire section between Maizuru and Kobe.

sen.j: JR西日本も一時は大阪－舞鶴間に優等列車が1日2往復運行させていたが、山陰本線や舞鶴線の電化開業に伴い廃止されると、逆に京都交通バスが従来の舞鶴－大阪梅田線（1日2往復）の他に、大阪 - 福知山・舞鶴・宮津線・神戸 - 福知山・舞鶴線を新設。
sen.e: JR West also provided a 2 round-trip service a day with higher category trains between Osaka and Maizuru for a while, however, when this JR's service was discontinued following the electrification of the San'in Main Line and Maizuru Line, Kyoto Kotsu Bus, in turn, set up two new routes, Osaka-Fukuchiyama/Maizuru/Miyazu Route, and Kobe-Fukuchiyama/Maizuru Route, in addition to the conventional Maizuru and Osaka Umeda Route (2 round-trip a day).
sen.cmt: 優等列車→定訳不明 [普通列車以上の列車の総称のようで、英語で相当する訳語がわかりませんでしたので、higher category trainとしました]
sen.e: Additionally, for a while JR West also provided two round-trip services a day with higher-category trains between Osaka and Maizuru; however, when this JR service was discontinued following the electrification of the San'in Main Line and Maizuru Line, Kyoto Kotsu Bus in turn set up two new routes--Osaka-Fukuchiyama/Maizuru/Miyazu Route, and Kobe-Fukuchiyama/Maizuru Route--in addition to the conventional Maizuru and Osaka Umeda Route (two round trips daily).

Additionally, for a while JR West also provided two round-trip services a day with higher-category trains between Osaka and Maizuru; however, when this JR service was discontinued following the electrification of the Sanin Main Line and Maizuru Line, Kyoto Kotsu Bus in turn set up two new routes--between Osaka and Fukuchiyama/Maizuru/Miyazu, and between Kobe and Fukuchiyama/Maizuru--in addition to the conventional route between Maizuru and Osaka Umeda (two round trips daily).
sen.cmt: アポストロフィを削除し、Sanin としました。

sen.j: 当初はともに3往復で運行していた高速バス路線であったが、現在は大阪なんば線が5往復、神戸三宮線が6往復にまで成長、従来の大阪梅田線を含めると計13復にまで充実させてきており、更に増発を検討中とのことで、確固たる地位を確立しつつある。
sen.e: At the outset, these were express bus routes with 3 round-trip each, however, they have grown to enhance their services to 5 round-trip in case of Osaka Nanba Route, 6 round-trip in case of Kobe Sannomiya Route, and in total to 13 round-trip including Osaka Umeda Route, with a plan of further increased frequency, and in this way, they are consolidating their strong position.

At the outset these were express bus routes with three round trips each, but they've subsequently enhanced their services to five round trips in the case of the Osaka Nanba Route, six round trips in the Kobe Sannomiya Route, and a total of 13 round trips including the Osaka Umeda Route, with a plan for further increased frequency; thus they're consolidating their strong position.

At the outset these were express bus routes with three round trips each, but they've subsequently enhanced their services to five round trips in the case of the Osaka Namba Route, six round trips in the Kobe Sannomiya Route, and a total of 13 round trips including the Osaka Umeda Route, with a plan for further increased frequency; thus they're consolidating their strong position.

sen.j: JR側も接続改善や割引切符等で対抗しているが、目に見える形での成果は出ていない。
sen.e: JR side also tries to compete by improving connections and introducing discount tickets, etc., however visible result has not been still achieved.
The JR side also tries to compete by improving connections and introducing discount tickets, etc., but to date no visible result has been achieved.
The JR side also tries to compete by improving connections and introducing discount tickets, etc., but to date no visible result has been achieved.

sen.j: 京都駅～東舞鶴駅間 上り5本・下り6本
sen.e: Kyoto Station - Higashi-Maizuru Station: 5 up trains and 6 down trains
Kyoto Station - Higashi-Maizuru Station: Five up trains and six down trains
Kyoto Station - Higashi-Maizuru Station: Five inbound trains and six outbound trains
sen.cmt: 上り、下り→inbound, outbound としました。

sen.j: うち1往復は多客期などに小浜駅まで延長運転されることがある。
sen.e: Of these, one round-trip is sometimes extended up to Obama Station when there are many passengers.
Of these, one round trip is sometimes extended up to Obama Station when there are many passengers.
Of these, one round trip is sometimes extended up to Obama Station when there are many passengers.

sen.j: 京都駅～綾部駅間 120km/h
sen.e: Kyoto Station～Ayabe Station: 120km/h
Kyoto Station～Ayabe Station: 120km/h
Kyoto Station - Ayabe Station: 120 km/h

sen.j: 綾部駅～東舞鶴駅間 95km/h
sen.e: Ayabe Station～Higashi-Maizuru Station: 95km/h
Ayabe Station～Higashi-Maizuru Station: 95km/h
Ayabe Station - Higashi-Maizuru Station: 95 km/h

sen.j: 東舞鶴駅～小浜駅間 85km/h
sen.e: Higashi-Maizuru Station～Obama Station: 85km/h
Higashi-Maizuru Station～Obama Station: 85km/h
Higashi-Maizuru Station - Obama Station: 85 km/h

Rolling stock used

sen.j: 国鉄183系電車
sen.e: JNR/JR Limited Express Series 183
JNR/JR Limited Express Series 183
JNR/JR Limited Express Series 183

sen.j: 全ての「まいづる」が、京都～綾部間は「たんば」などの福知山方面発着の特急列車と併結し、綾部駅にて、福知山方4両と京都方3両に分割される。
sen.e: All the train sets of "Maizuru" are operated between Kyoto Station and Ayabe Station, being coupled with a Limited Express train set starting and terminating at the Fukuchiyama area, such as "Tanba," and at Ayabe Station they are decoupled into a 4-car train set for Fukuchiyama and a 3-car train set for Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 併結→being coupled with a train set [http://yougo/rtri.or.jp/dic/]、分割される→be decoupled [http://yougo/rtri.or.jp/dic/]
sen.e: All the train sets of "Maizuru" are operated between Kyoto Station and Ayabe Station, being coupled with a limited-express train set starting and terminating at the Fukuchiyama area, such as "Tanba"; at Ayabe Station they're decoupled into a four-car train set for Fukuchiyama and a three-car train set for Kyoto.

All the train sets of 'Maizuru' are operated between Kyoto Station and Ayabe Station, being coupled with a limited-express train set starting and terminating at the Fukuchiyama area, such as 'Tanba'; at Ayabe Station they are decoupled into a four-car train set for Fukuchiyama and a three-car train set for Kyoto.
sen.cmt: "→ 'としました。"Tamba" -> "Tanba" に変更しました。

sen.j: したがって、全ての「まいづる」は普通車のみの3両で運転される。
sen.e: Therefore, all the train sets of "Maizuru" are operated using only 3 ordinary cars.
Therefore, all the train sets of "Maizuru" are operated using only three ordinary cars.
Therefore, all the train sets of 'Maizuru' are operated using only three ordinary cars.

sen.j: なおお盆などには輸送力が少ない「タンゴディスカバリー」の代役として走るが、その場合は7両フル編成で東舞鶴まで運転される。
sen.e: In special occasions such as Obon festival, this train is auxiliary operated in place of Limited Express "Tango Discovery," which has a limited transportation capacity, and runs up to Higashi-Maizuru Station with full scale train set of 7 cars.
sen.cmt: お盆→Obon festival [英辞郎 on the WEB]、7両フル編成→定訳不明 [full scale train set of 7 carsとしました]
sen.e: On special occasions such as the Obon Festival, this train provides auxiliary service in place of the limited express "Tango Discovery," which has a limited transportation capacity, and runs up to Higashi-Maizuru Station with a full-scale train set of seven cars.

On special occasions such as the Obon Festival, this train provides auxiliary service in place of the Limited Express 'Tango Discovery,' which has a limited transportation capacity, and runs up to Higashi-Maizuru Station with a full-scale train set of seven cars.

Train set

sen.j: 緑枠＝グリーン車 白枠＝普通車 (鉄道車両) 自＝自由席 指＝座席指定席 ※全車両禁煙
sen.e: flamed=First-class car ("Green Car") White framed=Ordinary car 自=non-reserved seat 指=reserved seat *whole train set nonsmoking
Flamed=First-class car ("Green Car") White framed=Ordinary car 自=non-reserved seat 指=reserved seat *whole train set nonsmoking
Green Framed=First-class car ("Green Car") White framed=Ordinary car 自=Non-reserved seat 指=Reserved seat *Whole train set nonsmoking
sen.cmt: flamed →framed としました。■はウェブを参照し「緑枠」としました。

sen.j: A＝きのさき B＝たんば C＝はしだて D＝まいづる
sen.e: =Kinosaki =Tanba =Hashidate =Maizuru
=Kinosaki =Tanba =Hashidate =Maizuru
A=Kinosaki/B=Tanba/C=Hashidate/D=Maizuru
sen.cmt: ■は表示されないため、便宜上ABCDで区別しました。

sen.j: まいづる4・10号は■＋■の編成
sen.e: Maizuru 4 and 10 are made up of ＋
Maizuru 4 and 10 are made up of ＋.
Maizuru No. 4 and No.10 are made up of A + D.
sen.cmt: ■は表示されないため、便宜上ABCDで区別しました。

sen.j: まいづる3・9号は■＋■の編成
sen.e: Maizuru 3 and 9 are made up of ＋
Maizuru 3 and 9 are made up of ＋.
Maizuru No.3 and No.9 are made up of C +D.
sen.cmt: ■は表示されないため、便宜上ABCDで区別しました。

sen.j: その他のまいづるは■＋■の編成
sen.e: Other trains of Maizuru are made up of ＋
Other trains of Maizuru are made up of ＋.
Other trains of Maizuru are made up of B + D.
sen.cmt: ■は表示されないため、便宜上ABCDで区別しました。

sen.j: 下りのまいづる全列車とたんば1.3.5.7号ならびにはしだて3.7号車両編成相互間（4号車と5号車）の通り抜けはできるが、綾部駅での切り離し作業準備のために同駅到着の約15分前（おおよその目安としては、和知駅に停車しない列車の場合、同駅を通過したあたりで行われると思われる）になると、通り抜けはできなくなる。
sen.e: In case that two of these train sets -- all down trains of Maizuru, Tanba 1, 3, 5 and 7, and Hashidate 3 and 7 -- are coupled, the passengers can pass through from a train set to another (passing through cars No,4 and 5), however, since the trains are decoupled at Ayabe Station, the passengers are not allowed to go through the wagons if there are less than 15 minutes to arrive the station (In case that the train go nonstop at Wachi Station, approximately after passing this station, decoupling seems to be carried out).
sen.cmt: 切り離し作業→be decoupled、切り離し→decoupling [ともに鉄道技術用語辞典 online, http://yougo.rtri.or.jp/dic/]、「通過したあたりで行われる」→「通過したあたりで切り離しが行われる」と解釈しました。
sen.e: If two of these train sets--all down trains of Maizuru, Tanba 1, 3, 5 and 7, and Hashidate 3 and 7--are coupled, the passengers can pass through from one train set to another (passing through cars 4 and 5), but since the trains are decoupled at Ayabe Station the passengers aren't allowed to go through the cars if station arrival is less than 15 minutes away (if the train goes nonstop at Wachi Station, it seems that decoupling is carried out shortly after this station is passed).

If two of these train sets--all outbound trains of Maizuru, Tanba nos. 1, 3, 5 and 7, and Hashidate nos. 3 and 7--are coupled, the passengers can pass through from one train set to another (passing through cars 4 and 5), but since the trains are decoupled at Ayabe Station the passengers aren't allowed to go through the cars if station arrival is less than 15 minutes away (if the train goes nonstop at Wachi Station, it seems that decoupling is carried out shortly after this station is passed).
sen.cmt: 上り、下り→inbound, outbound としました。Tamba -> Tanba に変更しました。

- Wakasa-Hongo Station - Obama Station>

sen.j: 凡例
sen.e: Legend
Legend
Legend

sen.j: ()内の駅は一部列車が停車。
sen.e: Stations in the parenthesis () : part of trains make a stop.
Stations in parentheses (): Some of the trains stop.
Stations in parentheses (): Some of the trains stop.

sen.j: <>内の駅は臨時延長時に運行。
sen.e: Stations in the parenthesis <> : trains in special extension are operated.
Stations in parentheses <>: Trains in special extensions are operated.
Stations in parentheses [] : Trains in special extensions are operated.
sen.cmt: 原文wikiを参照すると、こちらの文章では [] となっていましたので、左記のようにいたしました。ご確認をお願いします。

sen.j: 内の駅は延長時一部列車が停車。
sen.e: Stations inside the ●● : part of trains make a stop when their operation is extended.
sen.cmt: 「内の駅は」←一語「内」の前に入るような気がします。inside the ●● とクロマルにしておきます。
sen.e: Stations inside the ●●: Some of the trains stop when their operations are extended.
Stations in parentheses <>: Some of the trains stop when their operations are extended.
sen.cmt: 原文wikiを参照すると、こちらの文章では < >となっていましたので、左記のようにいたしました。ご確認をお願いします。

sen.j: 列車番号
sen.e: Train number
Train numbers
Train numbers

sen.j: 列車番号は304XM（Xは号数）である。
sen.e: Trains are numbered as 304XM (X is each train's ordinal number ("go-su")).
Trains are numbered as 304XM (X is each train's ordinal number ("go-su")).
Trains are numbered as 304XM (X is each train's ordinal number ("go-su")).

tit.cmt: 沿革→Corporate history [英辞郎 on the WEB]

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）10月2日 「まいづる」京都～東舞鶴間を1日3往復で運転開始。
sen.e: October 2, 1999: "Maizuru" began operating with 3 round-trip a day between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station.
October 2, 1999: "Maizuru" began operating with three round trips a day between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station.
October 2, 1999: 'Maizuru' began operating with three round trips a day between Kyoto Station and Higashi-Maizuru Station.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）3月15日 小浜線電化開業に伴い、臨時列車扱いながら小浜線への乗り入れ開始。
sen.e: March 15, 2003: Electrification of the Obama Line, the train extended its operation using the track on the Obama Line, although its status was a special train.
March 15, 2003: With the electrification of the Obama Line, the train extended its operation using the track on the Obama Line, although its status was that of a special train.
March 15, 2003: With the electrification of the Obama Line, the train extended its operation using the track on the Obama Line, although its status was that of a special train.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）10月1日 1.5往復増発。
sen.e: October 1, 2003: The train increased frequency in operation by adding 1.5 round-trip.
October 1, 2003: The train's frequency of operation was increased by adding 1.5 round trips.
October 1, 2003: The train's frequency of operation was increased by adding 1.5 round trips.

sen.j: 特急「たんば (列車)」との併結運転開始。
sen.e: Coupling of trainsets with Limited Express "Tanba (train)" began.
sen.cmt: 併結→coupling of trainsets [鉄道技術用語辞典 online, http://yougo.rtri.or.jp/dic/]
sen.e: The coupling of train sets with the limited express "Tanba" train began.
The coupling of train sets with the Limited Express 'Tanba (train)' began.
sen.cmt: 特急「たんば (列車)」→Limited Express 'Tamba (train)' としました。Tamba -> Tanba に変更しました。

sen.j: 2004年（平成16年）3月13日 1往復増発。
sen.e: March 13, 2004: Another round-trip service was added.
March 13, 2004: Another round-trip service was added.
March 13, 2004: Another round-trip service was added.

sen.j: 併結運転拡大。
sen.e: Operation by coupling of trainsets with "Tanba" was enhanced.
sen.cmt: 併結→coupling of trainsets [鉄道技術用語辞典 online, http://yougo.rtri.or.jp/dic/]
sen.e: Operations were enhanced with the coupling of train sets with "Tanba."
Operations were enhanced with the coupling of train sets.
sen.cmt: with Tanbaを削除しました（原文に記載がないため）。

sen.j: 「はしだて (列車)」とも併結運転を行う。
sen.e: Coupling of trainsets with "Hashidate (train)" also began.
sen.cmt: 併結→coupling of trainsets [鉄道技術用語辞典 online, http://yougo.rtri.or.jp/dic/]
sen.e: The coupling of train sets with the "Hashidate" train also began.
The coupling of train sets with the 'Hashidate (train)' train also began.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）3月18日 全面禁煙化を実施。
sen.e: March 18, 2007: Total prohibition of smoking was introduced.
March 18, 2007: The total prohibition of smoking was introduced.
March 18, 2007: The total prohibition of smoking was introduced.
